identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study Evaluating ANV600 Single Agent or in Combination With Pembrolizumab in Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors (EXPAND-1)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A First-in-human, Open-label, Multicenter Phase I/II Study to Evaluate the Safety and Anti-tumor Activity of ANV600 as Single Agent and in Combination With Pembrolizumab in Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors (EXPAND-1)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of study ANV600-001 is to characterize the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics, immunogenicity and antitumor activity of ANV600 administered as a single agent or in combination with pembrolizumab in adult participants with advanced solid tumors.

interventions.name: ANV600 + pembrolizumab (KEYTRUDA®)
interventions.description: ANV600 administered by intravenous (IV) infusion pembrolizumab (KEYTRUDA®) administered by intravenous (IV) infusion

primaryOutcomes.measure: Phase I dose escalation: Incidence of Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT) with ANV600 single agent and in combination with pembrolizumab combination with pembrolizumab
Phase I dose escalation: Frequency and severity of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) with ANV600 and in combination with pembrolizumab
Phase II: Objective Response Rate (ORR) using RECIST v1.1
Phase II: Duration of Response (DOR) using RECIST v1.1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase I Dose escalation: Serum concentration of ANV600 following a single dose and after repeated dosing
Phase I Dose escalation: Immunogenicity as indicated by the incidence of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) and neutralizing antibodies (nAb)
Phase I Dose escalation: Objective response rate (ORR) using RECIST v1.1
Phase I Dose escalation: Duration of response (DOR) using RECIST v1.1
Phase II: Frequency and severity of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) with ANV600 and in combination with pembrolizumab
Phase II: PK parameters based on ANV600 serum levels following a single dose and after repeated dosing
Phase II: Immunogenicity as indicated by the incidence of antidrug antibodies (ADA) and neutralizing antibodies (nAb)
